org.xmappr
Class Xmappr

java.lang.Object
  org.xmappr.Xmappr

public class Xmappr
extends java.lang.Object

A facade to Xmappr library, through which all serialization/deserialization calls are made.

Example usage: 

 Xmappr xmappr = new Xmappr(One.class);                 // initialize Xmappr & define mapping for class One
 One one = (One) xmappr.fromXml(inputXml);            // deserialize XML to object
Deserialization (XML-to-object) is done via fromXML() and fromXMLwithUnknown() methods.

Serialization (object-to-XML) is done via toXML() method.

Thread safety

Xmappr instance is thread-safe after it is initialized with given configuration. Afterwards no changes to configuration are allowed. Being thread-safe means that Xmappr can be called concurrently from multiple threads, allowing objects to be serialized/deserialized concurrently.

Preserving unmapped XML elements

Xmappr can be configured to internally store all XML subelements that are not mapped to concrete class fields. This way only a small part of a larger XML tree may be mapped to Java object, while preserving the rest of XML from input to output.

Example of storing unamapped elements: 

 Xmappr xmappr = new Xmappr(One.class);                         // initialize Xmappr & define mapping for class One
 Xmappr.Result result = xmappr.fromXMLwithUnmapped(inputXml);  // deserialize XML to object while storing unmapped XML
 

 One one = result.getObject();                               // get deserialized object from Result object
 ObjectStore store = result.getObjectStore()                 // unmapped XML is stored in binary form to ObjectStore
 

 xmappr.toXML(one, store, outputXmlWriter)                    // on serialization, stored objects must be provided
Note: only whole XML subelements are stored and not XML attributes or text elements. XML attributes and text elements must be mapped explicitly via configuration to be preserved from input to output.

fromXML

public java.lang.Object fromXML(java.io.Reader reader)
Reads XML data from provided Reader and returns a new object.

Parameters:
reader -
Returns:
A newly instantiated object containing XML mapped data..

fromXML

public java.lang.Object fromXML(java.io.Reader reader,
                                java.lang.Object targetObject)
Reads XML data from provided Reader and maps this data to provided object.

Parameters:
reader - XMLStreamReader where XML data will be read from.
targetObject - Object to which XML will be mapped.
Returns:
Provided target object. If provided target object was null then new object is created.

fromXMLwithUnmapped

public Xmappr.Result fromXMLwithUnmapped(java.io.Reader reader)
Reads XML data from provided Reader and returns Xmappr.Result.

Parameters:
reader -
Returns:
An instance of Xmappr.Reader, containing deserialized object and stored unmapped XML elements.

toXML

public void toXML(java.lang.Object source,
                  java.io.Writer writer)
Serializes source object to XML and writes it to Writer.

Parameters:
source - Object to be serialized.
writer - Writer from which XML data is read.

toXML

public void toXML(java.lang.Object source,
                  ObjectStore store,
                  java.io.Writer writer)
Serializes source object to XML and writes it to Writer. During serialization process also writes stored XML elements so that unmapped XML may be preserved.

Parameters:
source - Object to be serialized.
store - ObjectStore where unmapped XML elements are stored.
writer - Writer from which XML data is read.

setPrettyPrint

public void setPrettyPrint(boolean prettyPrint)
Sets output XML to be formatted in a human-readable form. Pretty print slows down Xmappr considerably, so it should only be used when testing or where human-readable output is needed.

Parameters:
prettyPrint -

addNamespace

public void addNamespace(java.lang.String prefix,
                         java.lang.String namespace)
Adds a XML namespace to the list of predefined namespaces. Predefined namespaces apply to all classes/fields in the mapping configuration.

Parameters:
prefix -
namespace -

Adds a XML namespace to the list of predefined namespaces. Predefined namespaces apply to all classes/fields in the mapping configuration.

Parameters:
compoundNamespace - Namespace definition must be in "prefix=namespaceURI" form
